business.headline: Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.
Sensex ends 484 points higher, Nifty above 25,700; Asian Paints jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 484.53 points higher at 83,952.19, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 124.55 points to close at 25,709.85.

Diwali 2025: From ETFs to SGBs, 5 smart ways to invest in goldWith gold prices at record levels this Diwali, many people are rethinking whether to buy jewellery or look at smarter investment routes. From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Buying just gold on Dhanteras? Why you should consider a mutual fund SIPAs Dhanteras's theme shifts from gold to goal-based investing, here is a detailed guide to help investors make smarter, purpose-driven financial choices this festive season.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

IMF chief says open trade key for India's continued economic riseIMF Director Kristalina Georgieva said that India stands out as one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and continues to make a major contribution to global growth because of its consistent reform efforts.

Canara HSBC Life listing today: What GMP hints about its debut on Dalal StreetThe IPO of Canara HSBC Life Insurance Company Limited was a book-built issue worth Rs 2,517.50 crore. It was entirely an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 23.75 crore shares.

Azoria CEO alleges ETF delisted after refusing to back firms hiring H-1B workersAzoria Capital's CEO alleges that his statement -- vowing not to invest in companies that replace American workers with H-1Bs -- led to a sudden move by the Board of Trustees of Tidal Trust III to delist the Azoria 500 Meritocracy ETF, a fund launched earlier this year.

Diwali Muhurat Trading 2025: Date, time and everything investors must knowThis year's Muhurat Trading will take place on Tuesday, October 21, 2025. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm.
Lost job? Here's how much PF you can withdraw under new EPFO rulesEPFO said the change is meant to safeguard retirement savings while still allowing access during tough times.
Infosys announces Rs 23 interim dividend. Check record date, payout detailsInfosys sweetened investor sentiment this Dhanteras week with a robust quarterly performance and a Rs 23 interim dividend.

entertainment.headline: Ek Deewane Ki... makers say PVR Inox favouring Thamma, cinema chain denies claim 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' makers have accused PVR INOX of favouring 'Thamma' in screen distribution this Diwali. The dispute raises questions about fairness in multiplex film showcasing and may lead to regulatory intervention.

Kerala High Court to screen Haal amid A certificate, beef biryani row The Kerala High Court will view the Malayalam film 'Haal' during a hearing on a petition contesting the Censor Board's A certificate and suggested edits. The court's decision is expected to impact how sensitive film content is reviewed.

Jatadhara trailer: Sonakshi Sinha is Pishachini in film about black magic, greed The trailer for supernatural film 'Jatadhara' was released digitally by Mahesh Babu. The film centres on black magic, folklore, and a supernatural being protecting treasure. It stars Sonakshi Sinha, Sudheer Babu, Shilpa Shirodkar and Divya Khossla, among others.

Hanumankind calls Ed Sheeran the nicest guy, Dhee and Santhosh Narayanan legends Hanumankind recalled how his surprise Coachella encounter with Ed Sheeran has evolved into a dynamic blend of global pop and South Indian sounds on Sheeran's new EP, 'Play'. Their song, 'Don't Look Down', also has Santhosh Narayanan and Dhee.

How Jitendra Kumar missed a golden chance to break away from his good guy image Jitendra Kumar's role in 'Bhagwat Chapter One: Raakshas' was a chance to break his 'good guy' image, but his stereotyped performance and the film's safe treatment kept his villainy from leaving a mark.

Dear MTV, thanks for making us 90s kids feel like pop stars. We will miss you MTV India will shut iconic music channels by the end of 2025. This marks the end of an era that shaped youth culture, fashion, and music discovery in India.

Our Fault review: Noah and Nick find happy ending, but at what cost?Release Date:Thu Oct 16, 2025 Starring Nicole Wallas and Gabriel Guevara, 'Our Fault' is now streaming on Prime Video. Is the final film in the three-part movie series worth your time? Find out here.

PVR INOX celebrates Shah Rukh Khan's birthday with nationwide film festival PVR INOX is celebrating Shah Rukh Khan's birthday with a special two-week film festival across 30 cities, showcasing his iconic movies and cinematic journey. This nostalgic event honours the superstar's enduring connection with audiences, coinciding with his recent National Award win for 'Jawan'.

Rise & Fall: Arbaz Patel admits friendship with Dhanashree Verma was not real Despite being close friends with 'Rise & Fall', actor Arbaz Patel has now clarified that his connection with choreographer Dhanashree Verma was just for the game. He also shared his thoughts on Arjun Bijlani winning the reality show.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: No elimination, Diwali cheer for contestants 'Bigg Boss 19' gears up for a festive Weekend Ka Vaar with no eliminations and Diwali celebrations hosted by Salman Khan. Ayushmann Khurrana, Rashmika Mandanna, and singer Shaan join the episode, while inside the house, Farrhana Bhatt's explosive captaincy move and Amaal Malik's outburst keep the drama alive.

Telusu Kada review: Siddu's rom-com is engaging but confusing like modern-day loveRelease Date:Fri Oct 17, 2025 'Telusu Kada' is a confident debut from Neerraja Kona, exploring modern love with bold themes and strong performances. While the film engages, its emotional depth and character arcs could have been sharper.

Lee Min Ho joins Yoo Hae Jin, Park Hae Il in new film The Assassins South Korean actor Lee Min Ho joins Yoo Hae Jin and Park Hae Il in upcoming film 'The Assassins'. The period thriller, directed by Hur Jin Ho, began filming in August.

From Heartstopper to Boots: How streaming is changing queer narratives Netflix's 'Boots' spotlights the hidden struggles of a closeted '90s Marine, marking a bold shift in OTT storytelling with authentic, diverse LGBTQ+ narratives.
Manav Kaul's supernatural thriller Baramulla to release on November 7 Netflix will release Baramulla, a genre-blending supernatural mystery film starring Manav Kaul and Bhasha Sumbli, on November 7.

Dude Review: Pradeep Ranganathan's eccentric charm keeps the fun rollingRelease Date:Fri Oct 17, 2025 Dude movie review: Director Keerthiswaran's 'Dude', starring Pradeep Ranganathan, Mamitha Baiju and Sarathkumar, is a romantic drama about complex relationship dynamics. The film, with an important social message, is absolute fun when it is self-aware.

Did this old KBC ad predict viral Ishit Bhatt episode with Amitabh Bachchan? Watch Ten-year-old Ishit Bhatt's confident yet controversial appearance on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has gone viral, drawing parallels with a three-year-old 'KBC' ad that predicted the moment. As writer Neeraj Singh's old script turns into real life, the incident has sparked a wider debate on parenting and children's behaviour.

Did Victoria's Secret models walk to this Kamal Haasan song? Read here A mashup featuring the Bollywood song 'Tere Mere Beech Mein' and Britney Spears' 'Toxic' was played during the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show 2025 in New York City. The combination attracted attention, highlighting the song's influence and musical connection.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan praises Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1 success Amitabh Bachchan commends Rishab Shetty and team for their work on 'Kantara: Chapter 1' on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17. The film, produced by Hombale Films, explores the origins and mythology of Kantara in the 4th Century AD.

Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana Bhatt chose captaincy over compassion. So what? Farrhana Bhatt's captaincy move in 'Bigg Boss 19' -- shredding Neelam's letter to stay in power -- has split the house and viewers alike. But was she really wrong, or just bold enough to play the villain on her own terms? Here's a look at how her unapologetic choice exposed the hypocrisy inside the house.

general news.headline: 3 Bangladeshis killed in Tripura after attacking locals, Delhi-Dhaka row eruptsIndia on Friday said that three Bangladeshi smugglers were killed in Tripura after they killed a villager. The incident, which took place on October 15, has sparked a diplomatic row, with Bangladesh demanding justice for the deceased and calling for an "immediate, impartial, and transparent investigation."

PM meets Egypt Foreign Minister in Delhi, praises Sisi's role in Gaza truce dealPM Modi highlighted progress in India-Egypt cooperation across trade, technology, energy, defence, and people-to-people ties. He had been invited to the Gaza Peace Summit in Sharm El Sheikh but did not attend; India was represented by Minister of State Kirti Vardhan Singh instead.

Trump to meet China's Xi in 2 weeks, says 100% tariffs unsustainableAmid fresh trade tensions between Washington and Beijing, Trump on Friday said he believed things would "be fine" with China. The US President said he expected to meet Xi Jinping soon.

Does Infosys mean intelligent? Siddaramaiah targets Murthys over caste surveyKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah hit back at Infosys founder NR Narayana Murthy and author Sudha Murty for skipping the state's Social and Educational Survey, saying, "Just because they're Infosys, do they know it all?"
He reiterated the exercise was for the entire population, not just backward classes.

Elections Hit by Inflation, Democracy in DangerCorruption is a feature, not a bug of the system of democracy. But reasonable restrictions must apply to prevent it from becoming an out and out kleptocracy.
Spicy X spat over Andhra's Google win ft 'bros' JDS, Karnataka CongressAndhra's new AI deal with Google powered an X meltdown between JD(S) youth leader Nikhil Kumar and the Karnataka Congress.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.

Big Gujarat reshuffle, Harsh Sanghavi is Deputy Chief Minister, 19 fresh facesThe BJP government in Gujarat expanded its council of ministers to 25, elevating Harsh Sanghavi as Deputy Chief Minister and inducting Rivaba Jadeja, alongside a mix of returning and first-time ministers.

Liquor baron, secret meetings: When RSS ignored BJP, helped Congress win electionAfter Indira Gandhi's assassination, Rajiv Gandhi reportedly had a secret meeting with then RSS chief Balasaheb Deoras, resulting in its cadre supporting the Congress in the 1984 Lok Sabha elections despite the BJP's presence. There were at least six secret meetings between Sangh members and the party, including one at the residence of liquor baron Kapil Mohan. The Congress registered the biggest-ever Lok Sabha election victory.

Battle of Baghpat 2.0: Vande Bharat staff clash with dustbins, belts in DelhiIn the incident that occurred on Friday, a group of IRCTC employees were seen hurling dustbins, swinging belts and trading blows on the platform in full public view.

Seat sharing in limbo, Congress leaders declare Tejashwi as chief minister faceAmid ongoing stalemate within Bihar's Mahagathbandhan over seat-sharing for the upcoming Assembly elections, Congress leaders Akhilesh Prasad Singh and Tariq Anwar indicated that RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav is expected to be the opposition alliance's chief ministerial face.

Return to your 'I hate India' tour: US singer trolls Rahul Gandhi over PM remarkUS singer Mary Millben defended PM Modi, saying he is not afraid of Trump and critiqued Rahul Gandhi's leadership. She told Gandhi to return to his "I hate India" tour, amid his allegations that PM Modi allowed the US to dictate India's Russian oil policy.
'Everyone's at a Diwali party except me'So what if you're not on the guest list - peace, pyjamas, and ladoos sound like a pretty good party too.

Why '93000' is trending amid videos of Taliban parading pants of Pak soldiersAfghanistan-Pakistan Conflict: While both Pakistan and Afghanistan have claimed the other blinked first, videos of Taliban fighters displaying trousers, allegedly of Pakistani soldiers who fled their posts, have ensured that Afghanistan is atleast winning the narrative war on social media.
5.6 magnitude earthquake jolts Afghanistan, tremors felt in Jammu and KashmirThe earthquake hit at a depth of 10 kms near the Afghanistan-Tajikistan border at around 5.45 pm on Friday.

Siddaramaiah's 'world record' moment goes bust as social media users fact checkAfter the Karnataka Chief Minister posted certificates from the London Book of World Records, social media users quickly discovered that the certifying company had been dissolved in the UK months earlier.

Dear MTV, thanks for making us 90s kids feel like pop stars. We will miss youMTV India will shut iconic music channels by the end of 2025. This marks the end of an era that shaped youth culture, fashion, and music discovery in India.

Caught taking Rs 8 lakh bribe, top Punjab cop sent to jail; says he's being framedAccording to the complainant, Bhullar, through his middleman Krishanu, demanded a bribe to "settle" an FIR. Bhullar allegedly also sought monthly payments ("sewa-paani") and threatened to falsely implicate the complainant in criminal cases if the payments were not made, the complaint further stated.

Who is Rivaba Jadeja, the new 'rockstar' in Gujarat Cabinet?Gujarat Cabinet Rejig: The development marks a steady rise for 34-year-old Rivaba in the ranks of the Gujarat government after she joined the BJP in March 2019.

Kerala High Court allows release of Dulquer Salmaan's seized luxury vehicleActor Dulquer Salmaan's Land Rover, seized by Customs under Operation Numkhor, will be released on a bank guarantee after Kerala High Court's direction. The vehicle cannot be taken outside Kerala, officials said.

Priyanka Chopra's red-hot look turns up the heat at London Diwali BallPriyanka Chopra mesmerised at the Diwali Ball in a striking red one-shoulder gown, adorned with sequins and a sweeping train. Take a look at the pictures here:

Exclusive: It's a people's win, says Hyderabad doctor behind ORS label banIndia's food regulator issued a ban on using 'ORS' label for sugary drinks after an eight-year campaign by a Hyderabad paediatrician. Dr. Sivaranjani Santosh calls it a "people's win."

VIP chief Mukesh Sahani not to contest Bihar polls, says will campaign for alliesMukesh Sahani, whose VIP is negotiating seat sharing with the Mahagathbandhan, said he has chosen not to enter the electoral fray himself this time. He attended his brother Santosh Sahani's nomination in Darbhanga and told reporters he would work for the alliance's prospects.
Madagascar's coup leader Colonel Michael Randrianirina sworn in as PresidentMadagascar Colonel Michael Randrianirina who plotted coup sworn in as President after stir toppled government

Pankaj Dheer prayer meet: Mukesh Khanna, Rohit Shetty, attend among othersSeveral celebrities, including Mukesh Khanna, Rohit Shetty and Esha Deol, attended the prayer meet of late actor Pankaj Dheer on Friday. The service was held at Iskcon in Mumbai's Juhu.

Ek Deewane Ki... makers say PVR Inox favouring Thamma, cinema chain denies claim'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' makers have accused PVR INOX of favouring 'Thamma' in screen distribution this Diwali. The dispute raises questions about fairness in multiplex film showcasing and may lead to regulatory intervention.

sports.headline: Were Virat and Rohit asked to retire from Tests? Agarkar responds to rumours Ajit Agarkar has set the record straight on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirements, confirming the decision was entirely theirs. Kohli and Rohit retired from Test cricket before India's tour of England earlier in 2025.

Ajit Agarkar responds to Mohammed Shami's angry reaction on AUS ODI snub India chief selector Ajit Agarkar clarified that Mohammed Shami's exclusion from the ODI squad against Australia was due to fitness concerns. His response came after the pacer publicly questioned the selection panel's decision.

Time for Harmanpreet Kaur to do an Alyssa Healy in big games: Nasser Hussain Nasser Hussain has said that Harmanpreet Kaur needs to step up like Alyssa Healy during big games. Harmanpreet has struggled for form in the four matches she has played as India have lost the last two games.

Omaima Sohail urges Pakistan batters to step up in crucial New Zealand clash Women's World Cup, NZ vs PAK: Omaima Sohail said that Pakistan batters need to step up and put in consistent performances to challenge opponents. On Saturday, Pakistan will be up against New Zealand in their upcoming clash in Colombo on Saturday.

Pakistan still hopeful of qualifying for Women's World Cup semifinal: Omaima Sohail Omaima Sohail said Pakistan still have a chance to reach the Women's World Cup semifinals if they win all three remaining matches, despite currently being last in the standings.

Agarkar's massive statement on Rohit Sharma-Virat Kohli ODI futures: Not on trial Ajit Agarkar has claimed that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will be assessed but aren't on trial during every match. Rohit and Kohli are set to make their return to international cricket during the Australia tour.

Watch: Sri Lanka batter cries in extreme pain after nasty blow against South Africa Women's World Cup 2025, SA vs SL: Sri Lanka batter Vishmi Gunaratne was stretchered off after she was struck on her left leg while trying to complete a single.

India's new ODI jersey with new sponsor logo draws mixed reactions from fans India unveiled its new ODI jersey featuring the Apollo Tyres logo ahead of the Perth series. Fans praised the design but criticized the logo size and placement, noting the "INDIA" tag sits lower than before.

Arsenal captain Martin Odegaard out for weeks after fresh injury blow Arsenal captain Martin Odegaard faces a lengthy spell on the sidelines with an MCL injury, as confirmed by manager Mikel Arteta. While Odegaard's absence continues, the Gunners receive positive updates on Piero Hincapie and Noni Madueke, who are edging closer to full fitness.

Watch: Travis Head chats with India's Nitish Reddy, Dhruv Jurel ahead of Perth ODI AUS vs IND: Australia star batter Travis Head was seen chatting with India all-rounder Axar Patel and wicketkeeper batter Dhruv Jurel during the photoshoot ahead of the Perth ODI between the two sides.

Phil Simmons on Bangladesh team attack at Dhaka airport: No social media for cricketers Bangladesh coach Phil Simmons has urged players to stay off social media after the team faced abuse from fans following their 3-0 ODI whitewash against Afghanistan. He also condemned the racial abuse directed at Jaker Ali, calling it "disgusting".

Watch: Sri Lanka batter cries in extreme pain after nasty blow against South Africa Women's World Cup 2025, SA vs SL: Sri Lanka batter Vishmi Gunaratne was stretchered off after she was struck on her left leg while trying to complete a single.

He also condemned the racial abuse directed at Jaker Ali, calling it "disgusting".

India team management should give Rohit room, time in new stint: Pravin AmrePravin Amre calls on the Indian team management to allow Rohit Sharma the freedom to settle into his specialist batting role after his exit as the captain of the team. Rohit will start a new stint as Shubman Gill has taken over as the ODI captain.

Joe Root to average 150 in Australia, England to win Ashes 3-1: Steve HarmisonEx-England pacer Steve Harmison has thrown his support behind Joe Root to put an end to his barren run of centuries in Australia. Harmison forecasts an outstanding Ashes campaign for the batter, projecting Root to thrive and England to secure a 3-1 series win in the 2025-26 Ashes.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma deserve Rafael Nadal-level farewell: Madan LalWhile India are all ready for their ODI series against Australia, Madan Lal urges the BCCI to give Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma a farewell akin to Rafael Nadal's, recognising their contributions to Indian cricket.

James Anderson set to extend career until 2026 with fresh Lancashire contract: ReportJames Anderson will extend his Lancashire career through the 2026 season, continuing as a key bowler and leader. He remains England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker with a 25-year domestic career.

Sanjay Manjrekar always criticised me…: R Ashwin slams trolling of Harshit RanaFormer spinner R Ashwin, speaking on his YouTube show, reiterated his stance against the trolling of Harshit Rana, citing how Sanjay Manjrekar had been one of his fiercest critics but never made personal remarks. Ashwin's comments come just days after Gautam Gambhir hit out at Kris Srikkanth over his statements about the young fast bowler.

Varun Chakravarthy praises Jasprit Bumrah with D Gukesh– Magnus Carlsen analogyIndia spinner Varun Chakravarthy has praised Jasprit Bumrah, drawing comparisons between him and legendary Chess player Magnus Carlsen, highlighting his unmatched status in cricket.

AIFF issues 15-year commercial rights tender for ISL: What does it include?The AIFF's decision to float a 15-year ISL commercial rights tender aims to end months of uncertainty. The move however, comes after a push from the football clubs in what was a strong-worded letter, blaming AIFF for breaching trust.

James Anderson set to extend career until 2026 with fresh Lancashire contract: ReportJames Anderson will extend his Lancashire career through the 2026 season, continuing as a key bowler and leader. He remains England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker with a 25-year domestic career.

Sanjay Manjrekar always criticised me…: R Ashwin slams trolling of Harshit RanaFormer spinner R Ashwin, speaking on his YouTube show, reiterated his stance against the trolling of Harshit Rana, citing how Sanjay Manjrekar had been one of his fiercest critics but never made personal remarks. Ashwin's comments come just days after Gautam Gambhir hit out at Kris Srikkanth over his statements about the young fast bowler.

The move however, comes after a push from the football clubs in what was a strong-worded letter, blaming AIFF for breaching trust.

Australian batter opens up on testicular cancer fight and cricket comebackNic Maddinson has revealed his challenging journey through testicular cancer, from surgery to chemotherapy. He hopes sharing his experience encourages others to get checked early and prioritize their health.

Shubman Gill can grow as captain with Rohit-Virat in dressing room: Axar PatelIndia all-rounder Axar Patel believes the upcoming three-match ODI series in Australia offers Shubman Gill a perfect platform to grow as a skipper, especially with former captains Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli still present in the dressing room to guide him.

Travis Head backs Rohit Sharma for 2027 World Cup, hopes to play alongside himIndia tour of Australia: Australia opener Travis Head said he is hopeful of seeing Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Head said he hasn't had the opportunity to personally interact with Rohit about his game.

Juventus under investigation by UEFA over financial fair playUEFA has formally notified Serie A club Juventus of a financial probe covering the 2022-23 to 2024–25 seasons, with potential outcomes including fines or restrictions on player registrations for European competitions.

Rohit's viral airport pics motivated him to be healthier and fit: Abhishek NayarRohit Sharma transformed his fitness regime after viral airport photos and has shed a lot of weight ahead of India's ODI series against Australia. He's set to mark his return to international cricket after seven months.

Virat Kohli delights Pakistani fan in Australia, signs India and RCB jerseyVirat Kohli met a Pakistani fan in Australia and signed India and RCB jerseys ahead of his ODI return. India are set to play a three-match ODI series against Australia beginning on October 19.

Two empty years, one chance: Indian football's pause could spark overdue revivalIndia's AFC Asian Cup dreams have ended in disappointment, leaving the next two years largely uncertain. Khalid Jamil and the AIFF now face the challenge of turning this void into a platform for real progress.

Labuschagne replaces injured Cameron Green in Australia's squad for India ODIsAustralia vs India: Marnus Labuschagne has been called up to replace the injured all-rounder Cameron Green in Australia's ODI squad for the three-match series against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
